report_title: Energy Drink Production in the US
executive_summary: Energy drink producers have expanded robustly through the end of 2023, outperforming most other packaged beverage production industries. Beverage producers have benefited from boosted per capita disposable incomes, which has allowed consumers to steadily purchase industry goods, particularly as impulse purchases at convenience stores. However, health concerns regarding the safety of consuming energy drinks have deflated previous surges in demand for these products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As per capita disposable income expands, discretionary spending budgets loosen and impulse purchases tend to expand, like of functional beverages and energy drinks, in convenience stores and vending machines. The mark-up in prices by convenience stores as compared with other retail outlets like supermarkets or warehouse clubs forces cost-conscious consumers to opt for alternatives that give them better value for their money, which is curbing the expansion of the energy drink production to some extent.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Health Trends Also Impact Consumer Beverage Choices
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Health consciousness among consumers also plays a vital role in shaping their beverage choices. Swelling awareness about the health effects of consuming large quantities of caffeine and sugar is gradually leading the bubbles to fizzle out for traditional energy drinks. Adverse media coverage relating to the health consequences of energy drink consumption has also added to this sentiment.

Different formats, like energy shots and energy drink mixes, have appealed to consumers with varied needs. While energy shots appeal to consumers that strictly drink for energy, energy drink mixes allow consumers to personalize beverages. Energy drink producers have also debuted many new flavors to achieve product differentiation.

The pandemic led to boosted stress and anxiety worldwide because of health worries, job insecurity and social isolation. As a result, many people have turned to energy drinks as they tend to contain high levels of caffeine and other ingredients believed to help boost energy levels, lift mood and assist in stress management. As more people started working from home due to lockdown restrictions, their work schedules became more irregular, with many working late into the night or juggling multiple responsibilities during the day, which strengthened the consumption of energy drinks.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Targeting New Consumer Groups Will Help Push Up Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Energy drinks have historically appealed to Hispanic consumers, millennials, working males and the nightlife crowd, but the introduction of new products that target specific consumer groups, like young, busy mothers, will encourage more consumers to turn to energy drinks to fulfill their needs. Targeting advertising and promotional activity will help brands diversify audiences.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: New Products Will Spark More Interest
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The swelling health consciousness among consumers is leading to a whole new market of all-natural and healthier products. This is evidenced by Yerba Mate's introduction of organic energy shots and Jamba Juice's all-natural energy drinks. Consumers are becoming increasingly wary of artificial ingredients and high caffeine content and, thus, gravitating towards healthier options. Initiatives by producers to offer healthier alternatives will undoubtedly spark more interest in the energy drinks industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Largest Producers Are Set to Continue Expanding
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Competition among energy drink producers will remain intense, with a relatively high average profit margin for the larger producers. Although more energy drink producers will join the industry, offering more niche products, larger producers will continue to buy out smaller niche producers to expand portfolios and maintain market share.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Online Marketing and E-Commerce Sales Are Set to Boost Market Share
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Internet and social media advertising are becoming expansively crucial in the marketing strategy of energy drink producers. Using digital platforms allows brands to reach a global audience and provides opportunities for consumer interaction and engagement. The swell in online shopping has opened a new sales channel for energy drink producers. E-commerce allows for direct-to-consumer sales, bypassing traditional brick-and-mortar stores and potentially boosting margins.

industry_definition: Energy drink producers manufacture soft drinks that help boost energy through various ingredients, including caffeine, vitamins and herbal supplements. Common vitamins and herbs include vitamin B, guarana and taurine.

threats: Per capita sugar and sweetener consumption

key_trends: Major energy drink producers have introduced new soft drink products, including many different sweeteners, to mitigate the losses from lower consumption. Strong brand loyalty and new
Artisanal products have allowed producers to keep prices high while input costs fluctuated.

Traditional energy drinks still account for a majority of sales, but energy shots are the fastest growing product segment. Alternative formats, like powdered drink mixes and liquid mixes, have contributed to energy drink producer expansion.

More than half of energy drink sales occur in convenience stores. This retail channel's contribution to energy drink revenue will dip as energy drink producers expand their networks to include more retail channels, like vending machines and discount retail stores.

Escalating concerns regarding the safety of caffeinated beverages have led government officials to propose legislation to curb consumption. As these regulations get passed, they have the potential to hamper the expansion of energy drink consumption.

Energy drink producers don't receive direct assistance from the government in the form of import tariffs, but they receive indirect assistance from trade associations. The American Beverage Association provides assistance for research and development initiatives.

Energy drink producers primarily market products to younger demographic groups and rely on various retail outlets to sell their products. Many of these producers establish distribution agreements with large beverage companies, like Coca-Cola and Pepsi, to help distribute products.
Boosting consumer health consciousness has reoriented demand for energy drinks. Energy drink producers are now stocking more low-calorie and cane sugar alternatives.
Regions with major metropolitan areas are home to several energy drink producers because of their access to end markets.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Convenience stores, including those attached to gas stations, are the leading point of purchase for energy drinks due to their 24/7 accessibility and enabling impulse purchases.
Consumers prefer purchasing beverages like energy drinks in bulk from warehouse clubs and supercenters for cost savings.
Supermarkets and grocery stores are a dependable retail source for energy drink sales, though health consciousness has reduced traditional energy drink purchases from this channel.
Vending machines in locations like rail and bus stations are a vital market for impulse purchases of energy drinks.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes canned drinks like Red Bull and Monster, which are commonly carbonated and contain high levels of sugar and additives.
This segment represents the core energy drink products that convenience stores stock and sell to consumers.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Low/No Calories or Sugar Energy Drinks
products_and_services.product_description: Producers are emphasizing these relatively healthier alternatives to sugary, caffeinated energy drinks in response to health concerns.
Energy shot products like 5-Hour Energy differentiate themselves by providing an immediate energy boost in a quickly consumed format, marketed as a healthier alternative.
These products allow consumers to mix their own energy drinks, providing flexibility and convenience, though this segment has remained relatively steady.

tier_2_suppliers: Syrup & Flavoring Production in the US
Vitamin & Supplement Manufacturing in the US
Plastic Bottle Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Convenience stores, including those attached to gas stations, are often open 24 hours per day, making them an ideal location for impulse purchases of energy drinks.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Warehouse clubs and supercenters attract bulk purchases
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Many households prefer to purchase beverages like energy drinks in bulk for cost savings from warehouse clubs and supercenters.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Supermarkets and grocery stores are reliable retail sources
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Supermarkets and grocery stores are a dependable source of sales for energy drink manufacturers and the most important retail channel for consumers.
Vending machines represent a vital market for impulse purchases of energy drinks in locations like rail and bus stations.
Online retailers are driving the expansion of other retailers selling energy drinks.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Austria, Switzerland, Mexico and Canada represent the leading sources of industry imports.
The major export markets are Canada, Mexico, Vietnam and Taiwan.

business_locations.location_description: The West region has the highest percentage (40%) of energy drink establishments, likely due to factors like a large consumer base, well-established infrastructure, and favorable climate conditions for growing key inputs like corn and sugarcane.

The Mid-Atlantic region is home to some of the biggest and most affluent cities in the United States, including Philadelphia, New York City and Washington, DC. The region also houses extensive rail infrastructure networks that facilitate trade.

The Southeast is the most populous region, providing plenty of downstream demand for energy drinks. The region also provides access to key raw materials like sugar, as well as relatively inexpensive and abundant labor.
The Southwest region has 10% of the energy drink establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Just prior to the current period, the American Medical Association called for a ban on advertising energy drinks to individuals under the age of 18. In response, the ABA created its own guidelines for labeling and marketing energy drinks, like not marketing energy drinks to children under 12 and not selling industry products in K-12 schools.

regulations_points.regulation_title: FEDERAL FOOD, DRUG AND COSMETIC ACT (FFDCA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The FFDCA, passed in 1938, gives authority to the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to oversee production of products like energy drinks. Energy drink producers must also follow regulations pertaining to ingredient labeling. While the FDA limits caffeine levels in beverages to 70 milligrams per 12-ounce soda, energy drinks are considered part of the food supplement category and, therefore, aren't regulated in the same way.

Although there wasn't any direct COVID-19 legislation for energy drink producers, the institution of stay-at-home orders, business closures and quarantines impacted these producers. Pressure on energy drink producers intensified as the pandemic heightened, especially as instances of energy drink consumption with alcohol persisted. Also, the Families First Coronavirus Response Act required employers to provide paid sick leave or expanded leave for reasons related to COVID-19.

In 2018, South Carolina proposed a bill to ban the sale of energy drinks with a caffeine count of 80 milligrams per nine ounces to minors, however, it wasn't passed. In 2019, Connecticut proposed a ban on selling to individuals under 16 years old and, if retailers fail to abide by the ban, they can incur fines. Maryland and California may follow suit, banning energy drink sales to minors.

The expanding popularity of energy drink consumption with alcohol has also complicated the energy drink producers' ability to maintain a positive reputation. Additional regulations focusing on alcohol and caffeine product consumption could emerge through the end of 2028.

factors_decreased_barrier: While most energy drink producers rely on manual labor to operate machinery, larger producers have adequate funding to invest in labor-saving machinery.

basis_points.basis_title: Price levels, range of products offered, product innovation and marketing
basis_points.basis_description: Energy drink producers compete based on several factors including price levels, range of products offered, product innovation and marketing.

Competition with producers of other ready-to-drink (RTD) beverages has intensified in recent years. Products manufactured by juice producers, like traditional and sparkling fruit drinks, have seen growth recently.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Monster Beverage Corporation owns many recognizable brands and can leverage production scale and established distribution networks, allowing it to dominate the Energy Drink Production industry. Red Bull's brand is also very popular and recognizable by many, allowing it to maintain a strong position among energy drink producers, offering immense competition for smaller producers. The largest energy drink producers aggressively market products and sponsor a wide variety of live entertainment events. Even PepsiCo Inc., one of the world's largest beverage companies, hasn't been able to capture substantial market share from companies like Red Bull and Monster Beverage Corporation.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: INPUT VOLATILITY EQUATES TO UNCERTAIN PURCHASE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Prices of key production inputs, including carbon dioxide gas, sugar, artificial sweeteners, high fructose corn syrup, caffeine, flavorings and food color sugar, as well as aluminum and plastic used to produce finished goods, have endured fluctuations.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: MARKETING IS VITAL TO ESTABLISHING BRAND RECOGNITION
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Marketing plays a role in product differentiation by allowing producers to charge a premium for certain products. Advertising expenditure has remained important since energy drink producers continuously seek ways to enhance brand loyalty and develop a presence on new media platforms, including social networking websites and media streaming websites.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES' SHARE OF REVENUE WILL CONTINUE EXPANDING
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The production of packaged beverages, like energy drinks, is largely automated, minimizing the need for manual labor. However, employees are still needed to manage each step of production. Producers also rely on marketing and research and development (R&D) professionals to market their brands and introduce new products.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: DESPITE RISING INPUT COSTS, PROFIT HAS REMAINED RELATIVELY THE SAME
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As health consequences from corn syrup become more apparent, energy drink producers switch to other sweeteners, like cane sugar, which tends to be more expensive for energy drink producers. Despite input price volatility, producers that adopt premium materials to cater to consumers' healthier diets can sustain substantial profit. Larger producers can achieve higher profit through lower per-unit costs of production since they can afford to invest in automated, energy-efficient facilities that need fewer employees, utilities and inputs. Producers can charge a premium for providing a jolt of energy to drinkers, a quality that consumers are willing to pay more for.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While most energy drink producers rely on manual labor to operate machinery, larger producers have adequate funding to invest in labor-saving machinery.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Everchanging Consumer Preferences Constantly Challenge Energy Drink Producers
volatility_points.volatility_description: While energy drinks are popular beverages, they aren't integral to a healthy diet and are consumed more or less often depending on individual consumer tastes.

volatility_points.volatility_title: INPUT PRICE VOLATILITY PROMOTES REVENUE SWINGS
volatility_points.volatility_description: Cost fluctuations of energy drink inputs like carbon dioxide gas, sugar, artificial sweeteners, high fructose corn syrup, caffeine, flavorings and food color sugar, influence selling prices and revenue direction trends.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment includes canned drinks, like Red Bull and Monster, which convenience stores stock and sell to consumers. These drinks are commonly carbonated, include a wide variety of ingredients and are known for containing high levels of sugar and additives not found in coffee products.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: ENERGY SHOTS REPRESENT AN ASSET TO PRODUCERS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment includes 5-Hour Energy products, the success of which has attracted many competitors into this segment. Energy shot products differentiate themselves from the larger energy drinks segment by providing a drink that is quickly consumed and provides immediate energy.

These products allow consumers to mix their own energy drinks and, thus, determine the amount of caffeine or energy they receive. These products provide consumers with flexibility and convenience if they don't have time to go buy an energy drink since many of these products can be mixed with water.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies specialize in energy drinks, but produce a variety of flavors and types of energy drinks, including energy shots and energy mixes.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: When consumers have more disposable income, they are more likely to purchase discretionary items, like energy drinks. When income levels drop, they may choose a less expensive or free alternative, like tap water.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in areas with well-established infrastructure?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies benefit from relationships with large retailers, pharmacies, convenient stores, supermarkets and warehouse clubs. Since the industry is dominated by several players, large companies benefit from acquiring smaller companies that serve a specific niche or specialty product.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to minimize wage costs by automating operations through the end of 2023?
FAQs.answer: Automation is important in order to maintain high and consistent levels of production on a daily basis. However, because of the necessity of R&D, companies still rely heavily on labor.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology, like RFID tags, etc.?
FAQs.answer: Companies use RFID tags to ensure that popular items are well-stocked and consumer demand is met.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: The FDA closely regulates the production of beverages for consumption and sets strict standards, however the energy drink production industry is largely self-regulated.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Many companies are represented by the American Beverage Association, which serves as a liaison between the industry, government and the public.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your company's customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Brand loyalty is important in energy drinks. Consumers will continue to purchase their brand of choice despite price hikes.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins have edged downward stemming from expanding product innovation and marketing efforts.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure your products are easily accessible? What retailers carry your products?
FAQs.answer: Many energy drink products benefit by ensuring their products are highly visible and accessible for consumers.

FAQs.question: How do you advertise your services? What are some other promotional methods that you use?
FAQs.answer: Due to the wide variety of product offerings in the industry, energy drink producers must differentiate their products by promoting them in various outlets, including sporting events, TV commercials and concerts.

FAQs.question: Do you have a reputation for good quality service? Do you manufacture any branded products?
FAQs.answer: Energy drink producers must strive to gain brand recognition among consumers to be competitive in the overall market.

FAQs.question: How do you take advantage of boosting concerns regarding weight? Has demand swelled through the end of 2023 as obesity has become more widespread?
FAQs.answer: As per capita sugar and sweetener consumption inches downward, demand from consumers who consume products with sugar and sweeteners drops as well.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the healthy eating index? How is your business impacted by an expansion or drop?
FAQs.answer: The healthy eating index represents the percentage of a recommended diet that the average American consumes.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of expanding disposable income levels? What price points are your beverages offered at?
FAQs.answer: Demand for discretionary packaged beverages, like energy drinks, is dependent on discretionary income levels.
